transcript:
Most professional football players, especially those playing in one of the big five European football leagues, earn salaries that range from “good” to “incredible.” Sadio Mané, Senegalese winger for English Premier League football club Liverpool, is no exception - but what is an exception could be his approach to spending the money he earns. That he was different from a stereotypical football player first came to light when the paparazzi noticed his phone’s screen was cracked and asked him about it. 

He said he didn’t see the point in spending money on a new phone when his old one was still working, and revealed what he instead considers a more worthwhile investment. “I was hungry, and I had to work in the field; I survived hard times, played football barefooted, I did not have an education and many other things, but today with what I earn thanks to football, I can help my people,” he told the press, adding, “I built schools, a stadium, we provide clothes, shoes, food for people who are in extreme poverty. 

In addition, I give 70 euros per month to all people in a very poor region of Senegal which contributes to their family economy.” Mané’s story could serve as an example of how easily life is improved for those living in extreme poverty - but instead of relying on the goodwill of a few rich people, we should have a system which lets everyone live a dignified life, either through a set income or through free access to basic services. That way, Mane would not have to feed entire villages - nor would they have to wonder what they will do once he retires.
Let's discuss Sadio Mané's story here

transcript:
As of the time of writing, the world is months-deep into a lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic. There have been several key takeaways from this: that we need to take better care of our environment, that we need to appreciate our friends and families more, and that there has to be a system in place to protect society from economic hardship during a crisis that cost millions of people their jobs, if not their lives. 

While this health crisis will pass, the International Monetary Fund now expects the global economy in 2020 to suffer its worst financial crisis since the Great Depression. Research professor at the University of London Guy Standing believes that it will be impossible to revive the global economy without a universal basic income. “We are going to have some sort of basic income system sooner or later, but I think getting the establishments of many countries to do it is like pulling the proverbial tooth,” he said. 

So far, many political parties are pushing for government help to citizens during the time of this crisis, but Standing warns that it will not be enough to only cover people’s expenses for a limited amount of time, as they are less likely to spend the money if they don’t expect to get any more anytime soon - and money not spent spells trouble for the whole economy.

transcript:
While at first glance, both Universal Basic Income (UBI) and Universal Basic Services (UBS) seem like perfect ways to help society, there are some very common counter arguments to both of them. One is the question of how either UBI or UBS would be funded. Many opponents of these ideas argue that there is no way to fund them, and that simply asking taxpayers to pay more is unfair. But an individual contribution is actually far less than it seems: after all, if you’re also a recipient of UBI (or using services provided for free by UBS), you’re getting a part of your contribution back - and if you’re extremely wealthy, you won’t feel the difference anyway. 

Another common argument, this time from people who support UBI/UBS, is, “Why should we give UBI/access to UBS to billionaires anyway?” It’s simple: a billionaire (or just someone wealthy) will simply return that favor through their taxes. But if they suddenly became destitute, they will still receive the income (that they have effectively prepaid). 

In the case of UBS, they would simply have to give up luxuries, but they would be able to live a dignified life either way. A third argument is that people would simply use their income/extra cash not spent on UBS on drugs and alcohol - but studies have proven that economic security improves decision-making, and unfortunately, the idea that poor people misuse any extra funds is much more of a hurtful stereotype than it is rooted in reality.

Let's discuss universal basic income here

questions.text: Is it realistically possible to implement UBI/UBS?
answers: no, it is inherently unfair to those earning more
yes, but only through trickle down economy
yes, with a forceful redistribution of wealth

transcript:
When talking about ways to improve people’s lives in a time when many jobs are becoming increasingly automated, people either propose Universal Basic Income (UBI) or Universal Basic Services (UBS). The first is the idea of offering a regular monetary stipend to everyone, so they can afford to survive, while the other proposes making services needed for survival free to everyone, so they don’t have to pay at all.

 Both of these approach the problem of global poverty in their own way: UBI solves it by offering people the money that would take them out of poverty, while UBS gives them access to services regardless of their income. The biggest difference, however, is that UBS takes away people’s freedom to choose what to do with their money that UBI offers them. 

While those who receive UBI could choose not to pay rent, instead using the money for more nefarious purposes, UBS doesn’t even give them that possibility - but it does let them earn money that they don’t have to pay rent with, so they can still misuse it. 

On the other hand, a successful business owner does not need as much money as a stay-at-home parent, so giving them the same amount doesn’t make much sense, while both of them need access to transportation and housing. This means that working out the specifics of UBI to make it more fair could take more time than simply implementing UBS, even if the latter restrains people in a way. Both of them are ways towards solving global poverty. UBI offers more freedom (and is often considered a more intuitive solution), but UBS would be easier to implement on current frameworks.

UBI and UBS can solve lots of problems

transcript:
The agreement that the taxes we pay go toward bettering our own lives is almost universally accepted. In many countries, this includes the healthcare and education systems, both of which are provided by the government. The idea behind Universal Basic Services, or UBS, is that we can expand those to other services needed for a dignified life, such as housing, sustenance, transport, information (like access to the internet), and even legal aid. Once a society has their basic needs taken care of, they can contribute to their environment better, as they are free to pursue a better education, or to apply themselves in areas that traditionally don’t pay too well but are useful to the world. 

The usual simple but low-paying jobs can easily be automated, which is already happening all around the world. An important, though hypothetical question that is often asked is, “How many people could have cured cancer, but were forced into hard labor jobs because they needed them to survive?” While the answer will remain unknown forever, it is obvious that simple survival is far from enough to optimize society. 

Free public housing means no more struggling to pay rent and utilities; access to good quality, nutritious food means people’s health is not an obstacle to reaching their potential; free public transport means more incentive to use that instead of private vehicles, which pollute the environment; free access to information means opportunities to better yourself; free legal aid means nobody can take advantage of you. All of these lead to a happier, healthier society full of people looking to give back to it.

Tell us what you think about this article

Of course, everyone knows that studying tenses, irregular verbs, and conjunctions - among many other things - are the key to a good basis for English, but only talking to someone else can take your skill to the next level. Now, thanks to technology, you can simply talk to chat robots, or chatbots as they’re more commonly known, who will teach you new concepts and correct any mistakes you make. One of the biggest advantages of chatbots, compared to humans, is that they’re available 24/7. 

They are usually designed to take your skill level into account and provide customized exercises tailored to your needs, and many will let you pick one of the offered options as a reply to the conversation. This prompts you to think about how each of the options fits in with the topic - but you can also type your own response in and see what happens. Additionally, the chatbots often have a pronunciation feature (how many of us who learned English primarily through reading never knew that “colonel” was pronounced “kernel?”), and offer the definition of any word you may not understand. 

For many learners who are new to the language, chatbots offer a less stressful environment. After all, you don’t have to worry about sounding silly or making terrible mistakes, because artificial intelligence just doesn’t care. Once you’re feeling confident, you can always have a more organic conversation by finding another human willing to talk.

transcript:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a field that sees regular advancements, and it’s long been a goal of humanity to recreate its own intelligence in machines. Now, social network Facebook is joining the race with its new chatbot “Blender”. Trained using 1.5 billion examples of human exchanges from public domains, Blender has been taught to demonstrate empathy, knowledge and personality. But it’s also come with its own issues. Since it learned from social media like Reddit, it’s sometimes resorted to using offensive language or even just made up facts. This makes Blender a very interesting example of exactly how humans sound online: either caring, compassionate and kind, or offensive and mean-spirited. 

One might argue that there is no real use for a mean chatbot, but the fact that it can so fully encapsulate the human experience is what sets it apart from a form of intelligence that can only emulate what we consider “nice” qualities. Blender’s source code is also available in open source on GitHub, so that anyone who wants to tweak it (or just take a look under the hood) can do so, bringing experts and amateurs alike from all over the world together to aid in the efforts of creating the best chatbot to date. 

Some of its limitations include the fact that it doesn’t remember the conversation after a while, and that it stops making sense after 14 turns on average. But that may just make it more human - how many of us remember everything we say to someone?

transcript:
With COVID-19 being the biggest pandemic the current world population has lived through, there is an abundance of misinformation or even malicious conspiracy theories doing the rounds right now. That’s why it’s important to stay informed without resorting to panic - and the people behind instant messaging application WhatsApp realize this. 

This is why they have introduced a chatbot which serves to bust the popular myths surrounding the virus. Currently only available in English, the company is working on a Hindu translation, and the bot also offers access to nearby fact-checkers who can provide support in languages such as Marathi, Telugu, and Urdu. 

Using the bot is relatively simple: after following a link or messaging “hi” to the number +1 727-291-2606, users are given a list of options, and after choosing a topic of interest, they can enter keywords or even short sentences pertaining to their inquiry. Aside from a short statement telling you whether the information you have entered is true or false, you will also get two recently fact-checked pieces of information, along with the link to the organisation’s page that did the fact-checking. 

Even if you don’t know what you’d like to learn more about, the bot will offer you a list of common misconceptions and explanations behind them, as well as tips on how to fight misinformation. While the feature is currently only available for information relating to the pandemic, many users are hoping that the company will add support for other topics as well to help combat fake news.

transcript:
There’s a popular urban myth that says that the only people who were not required to bow to the Japanese emperor were teachers, as there would be no emperor without them. While this myth is easily disprovable, it is an example of the fact that teachers are held in high esteem worldwide (which may not always be mirrored by their income). But, as with many other jobs, teachers in many areas are being replaced by artificial intelligence (AI), or robots. According to Chinese big data and AI company Squirrel AI Learning, machine teaching has consistently outperformed human teaching at four different teaching competitions held throughout China from October 2017 to December 2018. 

One difference was that machines were versatile and adaptable to different student profiles, so students receive information more tailored towards their own level of understanding, while human teachers can have trouble adjusting to a wide range of different profiles. The Squirrel AI system was also able to detect the causes of mistakes made by individual students and address them, enhancing divergent thinking, which is not necessarily intuitive to human teachers. 

The machine’s computing power also represents a strength not found in humans, which leads to a self-evolving teacher. While human teachers find that their energy and memory are both limited, machines have very little need for downtime other than regular maintenance. However, Squirrel AI Learning believes that AI can never fully replace human teachers -- but that humans who use AI in teaching will almost certainly replace those who do not.

questions.text: Which of these is not true?
answers: The text contains at least one opinion
All of the above are true

transcript:
Whittier is a small town located 60 miles south of Anchorage in Alaska. For a long time, the remote town was only accessible by boat or train, weather permitting. For the past fifteen years, it has been accessible by car via an old World War II rail tunnel.

Whittier is often referred to as the “town under one roof.” This is because almost the entire city of Whittier functions inside a single building called Begich Towers Incorporated, a massive Cold War building built in the 1970s. The town’s police station, hospital, grocery store, church and school are all contained in the self-sufficient building, which is also home to most of Whittier’s 220 residents. 

It snows an average of 22 feet a year in Whittier, so the residents’ lives are simplified by the fact that they don’t have to leave the building they live in if they don’t want to. There are rumors that some of the residents haven’t been outside for weeks, months or perhaps even years. 

The 14-story building, called BTI for short, feels like any other large apartment complex in a big city, except that once outside, there are few places to go. 
v
Most of Whittier’s 220 residents work in commercial fishing, tourism or for the state ferry and railroad. While Whitter is beautiful and safe, residents say that you have to be good at being by yourself to live there.

transcript:
Kashmir, a region located between India and Pakistan, is currently experiencing the world’s longest lockdown. There has been a territorial dispute between India and Pakistan over Kashmir for decades. In August 2019, India ignored Kashmir’s constitutional autonomy and took direct control from Delhi. The residents were ordered to stay at home by soldiers patrolling the streets. Their phone lines and Internet connection were also cut. 
In January, after nearly six months of being cut off from the rest of the world, the Kashmir Valley regained some basic 2G Internet access to government-approved sites. In early March, more restrictions were being lifted, but soon after the first COVID-19 cases were detected, the region was forced back into lockdown, with new rules in place against movement and social gatherings. 

While most people around the world have moved their lives online in response to the lockdowns, the people of Kashmir remain cut off from the rest of the world with no Internet or phone access. The government says that this is to prevent militants from planning attacks. 

Doctors in Kashmir say that the Internet restrictions are negatively impacting public health, as they must rely on slow 2G connections to download the latest medical advice regarding the virus. The fact that 8 million people can be deprived of Internet access and all that it offers - education, entertainment, job opportunities and mental health respite during this trying time, shows that even democracies can take away basic human rights.

questions.text: Which of the following is false?
answers: the current lockdown in Kashmir is the result of the dispute between India and Pakistan
even when access to the internet was reintroduced, it was heavily monitored
the new lockdown has some benefits on public health

transcript:
The pandemic has made it clear that no one is coming to save us. We must generate our own value, survival and recovery through connections and cooperation. In order to be successful going forward, we will need to adjust what success looks like, with collaboration and cooperation remaining front and center. 

Organizations and institutions can implement this by asking a few key questions. For example, who was heard, and how often? By asking this question, they can focus on developing to meet the needs of those they serve. 

Asking who was helped also addresses whether or not direct needs were served through listening, and opens up the possibility that news ways of helping can be discovered. 

As individuals, we can also focus on a few key things to help us collaborate and cooperate with those around us. 
We can start by practicing active listening. An active listener’s goal is to understand better, which demonstrates respect, builds trust and makes others feel valued. 

We can also employ empathy. Becoming more empathetic involves shifting our mindset to put people first; seeing others as humans rather than a means to an end. When we see things from another’s perspective, we’re better able to understand our colleagues, partners and customers, which will enhance our ability to communicate with them.

answers: COVID-19 Means Every Man for Himself

answers: by anticipating their needs and desires in order to remove the need to ask for them
by listening to them and finding ways to help everyone without discrimination
by enabling a level playing ground for everyone to pursue their desires
by helping those who need it the most and offering them a brighter future

corporations should focus on learning how to meet people’s needs by listening to them

building meaningful connections can significantly improve a community

answers: by treating them as well as they would treat themselves

transcript:
Many of us have spent the last few months following YouTube exercise tutorials in a bid to keep active, strong and to avoid those pesky “Lockdown Pounds”. But now, some countries and states have agreed to let gyms open up, so long as they follow strict social distancing and hygiene protocols. 

Plenty of eager clientele will no doubt return through the doors as soon as they open, perhaps even relishing the idea of a less crowded workout area. However, given how infectious the coronavirus has been shown to be, it appears that it’ll be quite a while until spaces like gyms will have the full trust of the public again. 

Even if gyms follow protocol by keeping “safe” distances between customers, and keep equipment regularly sanitized, is it really possible to safeguard a space where people come together, sweat, breathe heavily and share equipment against infection? After all, data shows that it only takes one infected person to trigger a bigger cluster of infections. “It doesn’t make sense that indoor gyms are reopening,” says one former city health commissioner. “The risks from heavy breathing in a confined space are simply too great.”

A physiologist at the Mayo Clinic takes a more balanced view, “There are smart ways to reopen, and there are ways to turn any gym into one big incubator (of infections).” The smart approach, it seems, would be to restrict the number of people allowed in a gym at one time, but one wonders how long such measures will be necessary for. It appears that ultimately, the popularity of gyms won’t fully return until the risk of the coronavirus is a thing of the past.

questions.text: What is the main point of this text?
answers: People have mixed feelings about gyms reopening.
It’s not safe for gyms to reopen.

transcript:
Not all immune systems are equal -- some are more effective than others. Most of us know at least one person who claims they never get sick, not even with a common cold or a seasonal flu. On the other hand, chances are you know someone who seems to catch a cold almost every month. The good news is that our immune system is within our control. Through taking the right simple steps, we can quickly boost the body’s ability to combat illness and disease. 

First up is diet. You don’t necessarily have to radically change what you eat, but a good way to start is by consuming more foods or supplements that contain prebiotics and probiotics. These populate our gut with more healthy bacteria, which we need to fight off “bad” bacteria. On top of this, Vitamin C-rich foods such as citrus fruit and antioxidant-rich foods like carrots and spinach will have a fast effect on your immune system’s performance. One lesser known immune “superfood” is garlic. When crushed or chopped, it produces a compound called Allicin, which has been shown to reduce inflammation in the body. 


Reducing inflammation is a huge part of avoiding illness in general. Luckily, this is also within our control. Simple measures like quality sleep, regular hard exercise, and keeping our blood sugar regulated all massively reduce inflammation. Studies have shown that stress and anxiety are among the biggest contributors to inflammation, and in turn a weakened immune system. To that end, relieving stress in a healthy way will do wonders for your immune system, be it through meditation, yoga or simple breathing techniques.

One rather extreme immune boosting method has been growing in popularity of late - cold water therapy. It sounds counterintuitive, but swimming in cold water, or simply taking a 30-second blast of cold water while showering, actually provides a wide range of benefits, including immune response to illness like the cold! As well as quickly reducing inflammation, cold water exposure teaches our bodies to deal better with stress, and boosts our mood. Over time, it actually increases our body’s production of white blood cells, which fight off infections. 

While you may not be keen to hop in an icy shower every morning, you can still boost your immune system in a more gentle manner by making sure to rest well, eat well, and exercise regularly.

questions.text: What is true about cold water therapy?
answers: It decreases our body’s production of white blood cells.

transcript:
Many people do not believe that food and housing should be basic human rights, rather they should be something you have to work for. However, according to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), around 14% of the world’s food is lost from post-harvest up to (but not including) the retail level. A big part of this is limited shelf life, the need for food products to meet aesthetic standards in terms of colour, shape and size, and variability in demand. The FAO also estimates that around 10.7% of the world’s population is suffering from chronic malnourishment as of 2016. Matching up these percentages, the problem of world hunger seems to be easy to solve.

In a similar vein, about 2% of the world’s population is estimated to be homeless, while another 20% lacks adequate housing. Reasons for homelessness include “shortages of affordable housing, privatization of civic services, investment speculation in housing, and unplanned and rapid urbanization,” according to demographer Joseph Chamie. Yet the houses are there -- it’s just that many landlords will decide not to rent at all if nobody can pay their price.

Both of these examples serve to illustrate the concept of artificial scarcity: in a capitalist system, an enterprise is judged to be successful and efficient if it is profitable. For maximum profits, some may opt to restrict production rather than utilize their resources to the fullest. Artificial scarcity is said to be necessary to promote the development of goods, as higher prices can serve as an incentive for increased competition. Opponents, however, argue that it enables the owner to capitalise off ideas and products that are otherwise not property in the physical sense. But the biggest question is this: are we willing to leave a fellow human being to die because we choose profit instead? Unfortunately, it seems many of us are.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of this text?
answers: To explain why artificial scarcity is a good thing overall.
To explain how artificial scarcity affects some forms of suffering.

questions.text: Which of the following is true, according to the text?
answers: There is not enough food in the world for everyone.
Nobody would choose profit over the lives of others.
Production is often limited in order to gain more profit.
There is not enough housing to provide homes for everyone.

questions.text: Which of the following is not included in the text?
answers: All of the above are included.

transcript:
Gross domestic product, most commonly abbreviated as GDP, seems like one of the most important numbers in a conversation about a country’s standard of living. The most basic definition explains that GDP is a monetary measure of the market value of all the final goods and services produced in a specific time period. Mostly, we talk about GDP per capita, or per person, meaning the number just gets divided by the average population. This is GDP (nominal) per capita. GDP (at purchasing power parity, or PPP) per capita is considered a more accurate calculation, as it takes the cost of living in a certain country into account as well.

Coming back to the topic of our title, the most intuitive answer is that the higher the GDP is, the better an individual has it. In large part, this holds true: countries with higher GDP per capita have better life expectancy. However, GDP is not the only reason for this: Costa Rica’s universal healthcare system, considered some of the best in Latin America, means that their life expectancy is the same as in the United States at only 20% of the US’ GDP per capita. Additionally, happiness levels in both the US and UK remain largely unchanged since the 1970s, while GDP per capita has skyrocketed. 

Most of all, past a certain point, the correlation between well-being and GDP simply falls apart. A study shows that after this threshold, the social and environmental costs of GDP growth become significant enough to cancel out consumption-related gains. These statistics are often used by proponents of the degrowth movement to show that incessant production does not have to be the modus operandi for the world -- at least if we intend to keep it for much longer.

questions.text: What is the main idea of the text?
answers: GDP does not correlate totally with health and wellbeing.
GDP has no influence at all on peoples’ health.
The higher a country’s GDP, the happier its citizens.
The USA has a high GDP.

questions.text: Using the context of the text, what does the term ‘capita’ mean?
According to the text, what is the main reason for Costa Rica’s average life expectancy?
answers: Costa Rica has a high GDP, therefore most people can afford expensive healthcare.
All Costa Rican citizens are entitled to high quality healthcare, regardless of their wealth.

transcript:
The concept of degrowth aims to reduce the radical production that thrives in Capitalism, bringing it down to the levels needed to sustain dignified human lives and nothing more. The current regime, which encourages growth at any price, serves to create unnecessary competition among people and a highly individualistic society that seems to forget the concept of empathy way too often -- all the while creating a strain on the planet and endangering, if not completely wiping out, lifeforms beyond our own. But it is also set up in a way that it only works if people are constantly producing more of everything -- otherwise a recession breaks out, leading to a general decline in economic activity, people losing jobs, and inflation. Even for the most developed economies, recessions are a stressful time at best, and downright destructive at worst.

Degrowth, in that way, would logically lead to a recession, simply because production is dropping. However, proponents of the movement state that there can be no recession because a recession is a phenomenon belonging to the current system, while degrowth proposes abolishing capitalist principles completely. The transformation to this new system would mean a fairer redistribution of resources and shifting our focus from an obsession with economic growth towards the wellbeing of the population, social justice and ecological sustainability. 

In other words, a recession is a shrinkage of the existing, growth-based economy, while degrowth aims to do away with it completely by not needing such extreme growth in the first place. After all, there is absolutely enough for everyone on the Earth -- but it’s locked away by a select few to artificially create a system in which you can only get the crumbs off their table.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of this text?
answers: To offer a research based analysis

questions.text: Which of these statements about the text is correct?
answers: It points out some flaws in the capitalism
It gives some explanation to the effects of a recession

questions.text: Which of these would be a suitable alternative title for the text?
answers: What is Degrowth and How Does it Work?

transcript:
Modern lifestyles often blur the lines between needs and wants, often convincing us that we need things that we actually just want and could very well do without. But this is not a completely new thing: James Maitland, the eighth Earl of Lauderdale, argued in his paradox -- that later came to be associated with his name -- that there was an inverse correlation between public wealth and private riches in a way that increasing private riches often meant diminishing public wealth. And therein lies the difference: public wealth, according to Maitland, is what people need. He goes a step further from bare necessities and states that public wealth “consist[s] of all that man desires, as useful or delightful to him.” The difference between that and private riches, then, is that they require something additional, making them “all that man desires as useful or delightful to him; which exists in a degree of scarcity.”

That way, “riches” simply represent something that you have, that not everyone else can get. While this makes sense for things like gold and art, the problem is in the need to have what others do not only want, but need, which leads to the privatization of public wealth and services. This can range from privatized healthcare to privatized potable water (Nestle is a particularly egregious example), and while it increases the measured riches of a nation or corporation or even individual, the general population suffers. In this way, the constant capitalist race of acquiring more while seeing other humans only as competition, devoid of empathy, leads to happy graphs and full pockets of the chosen few, but a widening chasm between owning excess and struggling to survive.

questions.text: Which of the following can be inferred from the text?
answers: The author does not believe overt Capitalism is ultimately a good thing
The author disagrees with the privatization of potable water

transcript:
Rainforests are vital to our planet. They regulate weather by creating clouds that reflect the sun’s heat so that our planet doesn’t overheat, they generate lots of water, which is carried by air currents around the world, they help to remove carbon from the atmosphere, and they give us food, timber, and medicine. Rainforests are also home to half of the world’s species that live on land. Each of these animals, insects, and plants interacts with each other in important ways that help keep the rainforests running properly. However, with the rate at which humans are cutting down trees and clearing patches of land, rainforests are actually in danger.

 The interesting thing is we don’t actually need to cut down any more trees or clear any more land because we already have all the food and timber we could possibly need. Instead, we need to start thinking about how to use the land in a smart way. Pulp and paper companies are beginning to regenerate degraded land to plant fast-growing and super-efficient plantations. They are also restoring the rainforests around their plantations. Some palm oil companies use what they can from the degraded lands in Borneo instead of cutting down trees and clearing more land. Across the world, these methods of taking care of the rainforests are spreading. 

A benefit of planting efficient crops on existing cleared land has resulted in new rainforests that retain more water and prevent fires. If we are already starting to use the land in a more smart way and are already seeing some benefits, imagine what the results would be if more companies started using existing cleared land in a similar way.

Lumber and medications can be manufactured from their natural resources.

answers: To promote the use of our Earth’s rainforests for their natural resources.
To suggest that more companies ought to use rainforests in smarter, more eco friendly ways.
To explain the benefits of exploiting the planet’s rainforests.
To give insight into the problems associated with rainforest deforestation.

transcript:
The tropical rainforest in New Guinea houses some of the most exotic birds of paradise. It is home to the twelve-wired bird of paradise, a medium-sized black and yellow male bird with twelve blackish, wire-like filaments on its tail; the black sicklebill, a larger jet-black male bird with metallic blue highlights; and, possibly the most impressive bird of paradise around, the western parotia, a medium-sized black male bird with some tricks up its feathers. 

Though each male bird of paradise has its own unique way of attracting a mate, a male western parotia takes the cake. First, it begins by clearing its “stage”, or the jungle floor, by removing pieces of twigs and loose leaves that fall from the trees. When everything is tidy and in order, it waits for a prospect. When a female bird shows some interest, the western parotia opens his dance number with a bow before his eyes flash from blue to yellow. When that happens, he puffs up his feathers so that they form a circle around his body and he begins to dance. He sidesteps and twirls about, occasionally stopping to bob his head from side to side. 

And if this doesn’t impress the female quite yet, then the male western parotia has one last trick to use: his bright yellow throat, which he flashes at her periodically. The exposure of his beautiful throat typically sends the female into a frenzy, which then concludes the ritual dance. If there’s anything we can learn from this bird, it is that we should never underestimate the power of some good dance moves.

questions.text: How does the western parotia bird attract its partner?
answers: It will greet a female bird by calling to her.
It will contract its feathers to enlarge its appearance.
It will remain completely till but oscillate its head.
It will sometimes flaunt its neck.

transcript:
The African Congo rainforest is the world’s youngest rainforest and home to large animals such as mountain gorillas. Each gorilla family is led by a dominant male and it is his job to protect the family from any danger, whether that involves any rival males or poaching humans. In the last 20 years, poaching has become an increasingly big problem to gorillas, decreasing their total population to nearly half. As a result, mountain gorillas have become critically endangered. 

Another animal that is threatened by poaching are elephants as their long, beautiful tusks are sought after. In the forest itself, gorillas and elephants must be constantly on the lookout; however, they can seek refuge at Mbeli Bai, a large swamp where many animals go to eat and drink water. Gorillas come to the Bai to feed on aquatic plants, which is rich in salt, while the elephants drink water or mine salts from the mud using their long trunks. 

Mbeli Bai is considered a safe haven for gorillas and elephants as it is well protected from poaching; however, danger returns once they leave the clearing. To prevent these animals from becoming endangered or extinct, people are grouping together to form organizations that raise global awareness and help to protect and conserve these animals. As a consumer, it is also important to make sure you are not buying products that are made from wild animal parts. At the end of the day, each animal plays a vital role in the ecosystem it lives in. If one animal dies off, then many more species will suffer.

questions.text: What is the main idea of this text?
answers: Poaching in the African Congo rainforest is an evil necessary for consumerism.
The ecosystem is hardly dependent on the animals that exist within it to thrive.
Consumers who purchase wild animal products are actively helping to reduce poaching.
The endangered species of the African Congo rainforest are dependent on organizations for their protection.

transcript:
Ice is not just for penguins and polar bears to stand on; it is important to our planet. There are three types of ice. First, there is sea ice. Sea ice is simply frozen ocean water found in the Arctic and Antarctic that forms, grows, and melts in the ocean. Second, there is land ice. Land ice includes the ice caps and glaciers. Their main job is to prevent floods and keep sea levels constant. The last type of ice is known as permafrost, which is a thick subsurface layer of soil that remains permanently frozen all year round. 

Permafrost stores almost twice the amount of carbon that is currently in the atmosphere and it is already beginning to melt. Due to its bright surface, ice and snow reflect the sun’s rays back into space, which helps to keep the temperature in the Polar Regions relatively cool because little heat is being absorbed. However, as temperatures begin to gradually rise and melt the ice, there are less bright surfaces for the sun’s rays to reflect off of, which results in more heat absorption and melting ice. If permafrost continues to melt, the carbon stored within will be released resulting in further climate change. 

The good news is that we can still save our planet’s ice from completely melting if we do our part to restore stability by limiting the amount of waste we produce and burn and by developing renewable energy technologies.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of this text?
answers: To raise awareness about the planet’s three types of ice and the roles they each play.
To promote the reduction of waste and further the development of renewable energy technologies to combat global warming.
To suggest the need to burn more human waste so that the Polar Regions of the planet remain cool.
To explain how permafrost and other types of ice are exacerbating global warming.

transcript:
It’s no secret that sharks are terrifying creatures of the ocean. The movie Jaws already proved this. But as terrifying as they may be, sharks are actually necessary to an aquatic biome. According to the Florida Museum of Natural History, a person has a greater chance of being struck by lightning than being attacked or killed by a shark. And yet, we are still afraid of sharks. Whether you like these big sharp-toothed fish or not, our oceans would look very different without them. 

A thriving reef is swarming with countless sharks and fish, and contrary to what one might think, sharks do not eat all the fish in sight; instead, they keep fish numbers under control. In a healthy reef, smaller fish graze on algae that grow on the coral. In turn, sharks protect these smaller fish by eating larger fish that prey on these smaller fish. Without sharks policing the reef, there would be too many predatory fish eating the smaller fish that feeds on algae. Without the smaller fish that grazes on the algae, the corals would be overtaken. 

Though sharks may be scary, they actually help to keep the reef in balance. Without them, the reefs would essentially die. Just as each fish and plant has their own role to play, we have ours as well by conserving the ocean wildlife and limiting pollution. If we can do our part to protect ocean communities, our oceans will thrive.

questions.text: Which statement best describes how sharks help maintain a thriving ocean reef?
answers: Sharks help eliminate the smaller fish that would otherwise prey on the reef’s coral.
Sharks eat the larger fish, which protects the smaller fish that eat the coral’s predatory algae.
Sharks eliminate the larger fish that would otherwise eat all of the algae growing on the reef’s coral.
Sharks eat the smaller fish, which protects the algae growing on the reef’s coral.

answers: Algae protects the outer layer of the coral reef.
Algae is a food source for all the fish that live in the reef.
Algae is a predator to the coral, but is regulated by the smaller fish.
Algae gives a place for smaller fish to hide from sharks.

transcript:
In today’s digital arena, YouTube has become the leading platform for viewing online video content. As a result, content creators are taking full advantage of the social media outlet by creating and posting videos and then reaping the economic payouts that come with every click/view. Creators can generate passive income from two potential sources. 

The first comes from automatic advertisements that can be attached to videos using Google’s AdSense. Essentially, creators earn money whenever viewers click on these ads. Another way to earn money for a video that gets uploaded to YouTube is through the video's content itself. While not all content in and of itself is monetizable, oftentimes videos will reference a product and/or service that the creator is offering for sale. For example, a fitness instructor who creates free workout videos might also offer nutritional and more extensive workout programs for sale on their website, which gets mentioned during the video or is attached in the video’s description. 

Creating video content is time consuming and hard work, and success is really dependent on being able to develop interesting and useful videos. Evenso, the opportunities to create YouTube content are endless as there are tons of niche markets that a creator can develop content for. Whether it be an area like music, food or language, creators can make videos for just about anything they are passionate about.

transcript:
For people interested in photography, there is an opportunity to profit from selling the photos online. And now with the advent of smartphones, everyone has the capability to take high-resolution photos without having to invest in expensive cameras and other photography equipment. Photographers should first start by creating photo portfolios and then uploading them to a photo platform like Shutterstock or iStockPhoto for the site’s clients to view and purchase. Also referred to as stock photos, all photos uploaded to these sites are marked with water markings, which is a logo placed on top of the photo to obscure the image before it’s been purchased. 

Once a stock photo is purchased, the client is given an unmarked, original version of the photo. Single photos can be sold again and again to multiple clients, which means they represent an opportunity for the owners to make money indefinitely and passively. In other words, once a photo is offered for sale on one of these platforms, the owner of the photo will be paid each and every time it’s purchased. The platforms typically offer one of two payment options: a percentage or a flat fee of each photo sold.

questions.text: According to the article, who has the capability to take high-resolution photos?
answers: Only those who have special photography equipment and cameras.

questions.text: What is a water marking?
answers: A logo placed on top of the photo to obscure the image before it’s been purchased.
An invisible code that is embedded into the photo.
A logo that obscures an image even after you purchase it.

answers: The photographer will be paid each and every time their photo has been purchased, which means he or she can make money indefinitely and passively.

transcript:
For those willing to invest a lot of their freetime upfront, writing an ebook could be a great way to create passive income for yourself. The first step to writing an ebook is figuring out what to write about, which will depend on things like your skill set, expertise, experience and interests. Generally, writing is done in one of two areas: fiction (e.g., fantasy, sci-fi, comedy, romance and mystery) and nonfiction (e.g., health, fitness, nutrition, cooking, technology and business). 

The former usually demands more time and investment from the writer as it requires developing things like a plotline, characters and dialogue. The latter, on the other hand, is often easier to write given there is less of a demand for the writer’s creative hand. Assuming a writer chooses to write a nonfiction ebook, the simpler approach of the two, the next step is to pick a topic that is both interesting and likely to generate a high volume of sales. Next, it's important to recognize the importance of creating an attention-grabbing title and cover page, one that will entice more people to buy the ebook. It’s often recommended to outsource the creation of your cover page to an artist, since an attractive cover page can help increase your sales potential. 

Before writing, it's also imperative to plan ahead by creating an outline for the material you are going to write about. While writing, keep in mind your authenticity as you want to provide your readers with new, valuable content that readers can apply to their own lives. After your ebook is complete, you will then have to decide how you want to sell the book, whether it be on your own website or through an ebook platform like Amazon.

questions.text: What is the first step to writing an ebook?
answers: Figuring out where you’re going to sell your ebook.
Figuring out the plot of your story.
Figuring out what to write about.

questions.text: Why is it easier to write a nonfiction book?
answers: It takes less time to write.
There is less of a demand for the writer’s creative hand.
The word count for a nonfiction book is generally way lower than a fiction book.
There aren’t as many topics to write about, which makes the initial process of choosing a topic easier.

answers: Your authenticity as you want to provide your readers with new, valuable content that readers can apply to their own lives.
To only write only when ideas come to you.
To outsource the creation of your cover page to an artist, since an attractive cover page can help increase your sales potential.
